The Related Discourses

13. The Noble Path

20. Arising of the Noble Path

Thus have I heard:1 One time, the Buddha stayed in the kingdom of Śrāvastī at Anāthapiṇḍada Park in Jeta Grove.

It was then that the Bhagavān addressed the monks, Suppose a monk’s right view is pure, cleansed, without fault, and free of afflictions. “When it has yet to happen, it doesn’t happen except by the discipline of the Buddha ... up to right concentration are likewise described. Suppose right view is pure, cleansed, without fault, and free of afflictions. When it has yet to happen, it can happen ... up to right concentration are likewise described.”

After the Buddha had taught this discourse, the monks who heard what the Buddha had taught rejoiced and handed it down.

Endnotes

  1. This sutra is parallel to SN 45.16.
Translator: Charles Patton
